snippet: In a class-action suit, a federal judge ruled that dancers at Rick’s Cabaret in Manhattan deserved at least the minimum wage.
abstract: Federal Judge Paul A Engelmayer rules dancers who strip at Rick's Cabaret are employees protected by federal and state labor laws and deserve at least minimum wage; ruling is result of class-action lawsuit filed on behalf of current and former dancers at the club that Rick’s opened near the Empire State Building in 2005.
lead_paragraph: In a class-action suit, a federal judge ruled that dancers at Rick’s Cabaret in Manhattan deserved at least the minimum wage.

headline.main: Strippers Are Protected by Labor Laws, Judge Says
headline.print_headline: Strippers Are Protected By Labor Laws, Judge Says
